Ramp Rates represent the full time needed to transition from one brightness level to the next and can be specified in increments of 0.1 seconds. Range: 0 to 540 sec.

NOTE: Hue light bulbs are not capable of displaying the same full spectrum of light that your computer monitor can display. Thus, when setting Red, Green, and Blue values, the bulb will switch to the closest color it can render to the color you specified.* Other supported color lights (LightStrips, LivingColors, etc.) have a wider color range and may represent certain colors (such as green) better.

Color temperature represents the shade of white being seen. When entering a Custom Temperature, a lower number means a "warmer", or more red shade of white. A higher number means a "cooler", or more blue shade of white.

Field.tooltip: Select a color temperature preset or select Custom Teperature/Brightness to enter a custom color temperature and brightness value. Presets are based on those provided by Philips for Hue.
Field.Label: Preset Color Recipes:
Select a "Preset Color Recipe" or select "Custom Temperature/Brightness" to specify a specific color temperature (in Kelvin).

Field.tooltip: Select how you'd like to specify a color temperature setting. Either by entering a color temperature or by specifying an Indigo variable that contains the color temperature value.
Field.Label: Temperature Source:

Field.tooltip: Enter a color temperature value in Kelvin. Range is 2000 to 6500, and only applies to Hue devices that support the use of color temperature.
Field.Label: Color Temperature:

Field.tooltip: Select an Indigo variable whose value at the time this action is executed will be used as the color temperature setting in Kelvin. The variable must have a value in the range of 2000 to 6500.
Field.Label: Color Temperature Variable:
(2000 - 6500 K) 2000 = very warm (more red). 6500 = very cool (more blue).

Select a Hue device effect. This feature requires the latest Hue hub firmware. Currently, the Hue system only offers the "Color Loop" effect which cycles through all hues at the current saturation and brightness level.

Hue Scenes are stored on the Hue hub and are organized here by which application created them.

Field.tooltip: Scene Creators are the applications on various devices that have connected to the Hue hub and created Scenes.
Field.Label: Scene Creator:
Select a Scene Creator from the hub first (or use "All Scene Creators").

Field.tooltip: Scenes are stored on the Hue hub along with which application created them. Scenes in this menu were created by the Scene Creator selected above.
Field.Label: Scene:
Some Scenes may have the same name because of how the Hue app creates them on the hub. Use the Lights Affected list below to distinguish between Scenes with the same name.

Field.tooltip: The Hue hub allows you to limit a Scene to just one Group, as long as at least one light in the Scene is part of the Group. Lights that are part of a Scene but NOT part of the selected Group Limit will not be affected.
Field.Label: Group Limit:
Limit the Scene to a specific Hue Group.

Field.tooltip: This list shows all the lights that will be affected by the combination of Scene and Group Limit selections above. These cannot be edited.
Field.Label: Lights Affected:
This list shows which lights are affected by the Scene and Group Limit selections above. This cannot be edited.
